title: How to Create a Cheese Platter for a Party

steps.headline: Consider the theme and general mood of the party to determine the fashion in which you want to display your cheese.
steps.description: If it is a relaxed, friendly gathering, your platter will be simpler than for a formal party.

steps.headline: Make a list of the beverages you will be serving.
steps.description: This will help you decide on the types of cheese you want to serve. List those next.

steps.headline: Divide your cheeses into hard and soft cheeses.
steps.description: Make sure to choose an equal amount of cheeses from each category. Also, select some mild and some sharp cheeses, to suit all tastes.

steps.headline: Choose an uneven number of different cheeses for your platter.
steps.description: It gives the platter a more pleasing appearance. In this article, we will work with the example of five cheeses.

steps.headline: Use a round platter for a less work-intensive display, and a square one if you want to create geometrical shapes with your cheese.
Arrange your cheeses on the round platter, placing a round one in the center and grouping the others around it in whichever way you like.
steps.description:
Garnish the platter with white and blue grapes, walnuts, and/ or sprigs of mint for a classical display. Other ideas of edible decoration to compliment your cheeses include:
Other types of nuts (pecan, for example), possibly roasted in honey, or honey itself. It is a great condiment for Gouda cheese. A small jar of raspberry jam or apple jelly. These choices go especially well with soft cheeses like Camembert. A small bowl of sweet mustard. While this sounds odd to some, old Gouda cheese with fig mustard is considered a very interesting and pleasing flavour experience.

steps.headline: Cut a hard cheese into rectangular slices and create a frame on a square platter.
steps.description: Place the other cheeses inside this frame. Decorate or supplement your platter as explained in Step 6.

steps.headline: Supply a cheese knife for your guests.
steps.description: You can do this by impaling it into a sturdy piece of cheese, if you like.

text:
Consider the theme and general mood of the party to determine the fashion in which you want to display your cheese. If it is a relaxed, friendly gathering, your platter will be simpler than for a formal party. Make a list of the beverages you will be serving. This will help you decide on the types of cheese you want to serve. List those next. Divide your cheeses into hard and soft cheeses. Make sure to choose an equal amount of cheeses from each category. Also, select some mild and some sharp cheeses, to suit all tastes. Choose an uneven number of different cheeses for your platter. It gives the platter a more pleasing appearance. In this article, we will work with the example of five cheeses. Use a round platter for a less work-intensive display, and a square one if you want to create geometrical shapes with your cheese.  Arrange your cheeses on the round platter, placing a round one in the center and grouping the others around it in whichever way you like. Garnish the platter with white and blue grapes, walnuts, and/ or sprigs of mint for a classical display. Other ideas of edible decoration to compliment your cheeses include:
Other types of nuts (pecan, for example), possibly roasted in honey, or honey itself. It is a great condiment for Gouda cheese. A small jar of raspberry jam or apple jelly. These choices go especially well with soft cheeses like Camembert. A small bowl of sweet mustard. While this sounds odd to some, old Gouda cheese with fig mustard is considered a very interesting and pleasing flavour experience. Cut a hard cheese into rectangular slices and create a frame on a square platter. Place the other cheeses inside this frame. Decorate or supplement your platter as explained in Step 6. Supply a cheese knife for your guests. You can do this by impaling it into a sturdy piece of cheese, if you like.
